definition: ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: We can try to buy some tickets outside the stadium from a scalper.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以试着在体育场外买黄牛票。

sentences.english: He bought the ticket at a high price from a (ticket) scalper.
sentences.chinese: 他从一个票贩子手里高价买了张黄牛票。

sentences.english: He's planning to go to Germany anyway and try for scalped tickets.
sentences.chinese: 他计划无论如何也要到德国去，并且努力买到黄牛票。

sentences.english: Fans will find it harder to get scalped tickets at the stadiums this year.
sentences.chinese: 球迷们发现今年的运动会的黄牛票比较难买到。

sentences.english: The move is part of a government effort to crack down on scalpers.
sentences.chinese: 这是政府打击黄牛票贩的一项举措。

definition: to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
ox/cattle/scalper of tickets etc/to fail to show up/to break a promise
to bounce (a check)/to return a ticket/ticket refund
inner area (of a place that has an outer area)/the kitchen of a restaurant (as opposed to the dining area)/infield (baseball etc)/(Chinese opera) the area behind the table on the stage
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
